acceptance-test-run.title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped float values with @PodamFloatValue annotation
acceptance-test-run.name: podamShouldHandleFloatValuesWithThePodamFloatValueAnnotation

test-step.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.FloatValuePojo

Then the Object FloatRangeValuesPojo ( floatFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0.0 floatFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 61.37383 floatFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 422.49286 floatFieldWithPreciseValue = 123456.0 floatObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0.0 floatObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 63.29256 floatObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 155.66605 floatObjectFieldWithPreciseValue = 123456.0 ) should not be null
Then the Float value 0.0 should be greater or equal than 0.0
Then the float value 61.37383 should be lower or equal than 100.0
Then the float value 422.49286 should be between 0.0 and 1000.0
Then the Object 0.0 should not be null
Then the Float value 0.0 should be greater or equal than 0.0
Then the Object 63.29256 should not be null
Then the float value 63.29256 should be lower or equal than 100.0
Then the Object 155.66605 should not be null
Then the float value 155.66605 should be between 0.0 and 1000.0
Then the float value 123456.0 should be precisely 123456.0
Then the Object 123456.0 should not be null
Then the float value 123456.0 should be precisely 123456.0
